subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Configuration Problem
author: Elabeth
full_text:
I'd hook the 469 to a speaker then hook the mic to the recorder and
place it to where it can pick up both your voice asking the questions
and the noise from the speaker. I'm sure there is a more complicated
way to do it though.
~Elabeth

On Wed, Aug 13, 2008 at 10:27 AM, Chad <cawiggins78@...> wrote:
> What's up guys? I need a little help here. I have the 469 hack, as
> well as an Olympus WS-110 digital recorder, and a mic. I am trying to
> configure my system to allow me to record not only my voice, but the
> hack at the same time. I ran a y-adapter from the mic input on the
> Olympus to the 469 as well as a mic. Now when I record, the mic does
> not record, only the 469. The mic acts as a speaker. What am I doing
> wrong here? I don't have an audio input on my laptop, just a built in
> mic. Any suggestions?
>
>
